inference:
The angles in $\triangle PQR$ are $6x^\circ$, $x^\circ$, and $3x^\circ$.
The sum of the angles in a triangle is $180^\circ$.
$6x + x + 3x = 180$
$10x = 180$
$x = 18$
The angles are $6x = 6(18) = 108^\circ$, $x = 18^\circ$, and $3x = 3(18) = 54^\circ$.
The largest angle is $108^\circ$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{108}$
ground_truth:
Since the sum of the angles in a triangle is $180^\circ,$ then  \begin{align*}
3x^\circ + x^\circ + 6x^\circ &= 180^\circ \\
10x &= 180 \\
x & = 18.
\end{align*}The largest angle in the triangle is $$6x^\circ = 6(18^\circ)=\boxed{108}^\circ.$$
